arts.ttl: 'We deserved the win today': Reading boss on dramatic victory over Bolton Wanderers
arts.sum: Reading boss Noel Hunt felt his side were worthy winners against Bolton Wanderers. A tight contest between two of the pack chasing the play-offs, Harvey Knibbs' 89th-minute penalty won the battle and ended a three-match losing streak for the Royals. Coming less than 24 hours after the departure of star striker Sam Smith, the club remain only outside the top six on goal difference. Speaking after the win, Hunt said: "I thought we looked really strong with a good structure. I thought the boys looked calm and mixed the game up well, which is what we’re looking for. I thought we were outstanding. Every man, to a tee, and the subs that came on. Even the boys behind me were encouraging and pressing with them, it was great to hear and great to watch."

arts.ttl: Reading end three-match losing run with last-gasp win over Bolton Wanderers
arts.sum: Harvey Knibbs' 89th minute penalty ensured Reading beat Bolton Wanderers 1-0, ending a three-match losing run. The Royals had endured a tough week, losing Sam Smith to Wrexham on Friday, and supporter apathy had hit an all-time high. However, a win over Bolton in Steven Schumacher's first match in charge ensured they kept pace with the play-offs. An even start, Reading enjoyed plenty of the ball and knocked it around confidently after a trio of defeats in quick succession. Bolton looked comfortable and neither side looked too keen to play much football on what was a cloggy pitch by modern standards. Neither side had much opportunity to build momentum, and any that had been acquired were lost when the two teams were given a break as Victor Adeboyejo received treatment for a head injury.

arts.ttl: Reading consign Steven Schumacher to defeat in first game as Bolton boss
arts.sum: Harvey Knibbs’ late penalty was enough for all three points.

arts.ttl: Reading team news: Jayden Wareham replaces sold Sam Smith for Bolton Wanderers test
arts.sum: Noel Hunt has opted to give Jayden Wareham a start in the central striker role following the departure of Sam Smith for this afternoon's clash with Bolton Wanderers. Wrexham signed Smith for £2m after 11 goals in the first part of the season, leaving the Royals with limited options up front. Wareham, a regular for cup matches, is yet to score a league goal for the club. He is one of two changes, as Kelvin Ehibhatiomhan is replaced by Mamadi Camara from the start. Joel Pereira remains in goal behind a back four of Michael Craig, Harlee Dean, Tyler Bindon and Andre Garcia.

arts.ttl: Live updates: Reading face Bolton Wanderers for Schumacher's first match
arts.sum: Reading host Bolton Wanderers at the end of yet another depressing week for the club. Star striker Sam Smith was sold to Wrexham, with the club citing the cash to be used for 'short-term funding' while the Trotters, on the back of three straight wins, have a new face in the dugout...Steven Schumacer.

arts.ttl: Bolton Wanderers fans column: Thank you, Jules! Welcome Steven!
arts.sum: Julian Darby’s affinity with Bolton Wanderers started by watching from the Burnden Park terraces as a kid before eventually playing for, and captaining, the club he always adored.

arts.ttl: Wrexham confirm signing of Reading forward for 'significant undisclosed fee'
arts.sum: Wrexham have confirmed the signing of Reading forward Sam Smith for a 'significant undisclosed' deal worth a reported £2m. The 26-year-old scored 11 goals for the Royals in the first part of the season, including in Tuesday's 3-2 defeat at Burton Albion. In total, he departs for a second time with 29 goals in 67 appearances having made his debut back in 2017. However, the Academy graduate has opted to sign a three-and-a-half year deal in North Wales as Phil Parkinson's side challenge for promotion to the Championship.

arts.ttl: Bolton Wanderers confirm managerial appointment 48 hours ahead of Reading trip
arts.sum: Bolton Wanderers confirmed the appointment of new manager Steven Schumacher less than 48 hours ahead of tomorrow's trip to Reading. The 40-year-old signs a three-and-a-half year deal with the Trotters, replacing Ian Evatt after more than four years in charge. The Lilywhites leapfrogged the Royals in the League One table in midweek as interim boss Julian Darby oversaw back-to-back wins and Reading continued a run of three successive defeats. The former Plymouth Argyle and Stoke City boss promotion from the third tier with the Pilgrims in 2023 and was named League One Manager of the Year.

arts.ttl: Swansea City consider Bolton Wanderers, Barnsley stars as potential Matt Grimes replacements
arts.sum: Swansea City are eyeing Bolton Wanderers’ Josh Sheehan and Barnsley star Luca Connell as potential midfield targets, according… The post Swansea City consider Bolton Wanderers, Barnsley stars as potential Matt Grimes replacements appeared first on The72 - Football League News.

arts.ttl: Bolton Wanderers bring two new backroom staff on board for Reading clash
arts.sum: Bolton Wanderers have confirmed two new members of Steven Schumacher's backroom staff ahead of their game at Reading this weekend.
